title: Fire Department 30 day calls
description:
A. SUMMARY
This dataset is derived from the Fire Department Calls for Service dataset. It includes summary data for the last 30 days. Summaries are presented by station area. The summary data includes number of calls and average response time (in minutes). Calls are further divided into emergency calls (Code 3) and non-emergency calls (Code 2).
B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED
Filters are applied to the raw data by selecting only the calls for the last 30 full days. The last day included in the dataset is the day before the day the dataset is extracted.
C. UPDATE PROCESS
Data is updated every day.
D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET
This dataset is just a summary of the existing Calls For Service Data. It is provided as a simple way for a user to collect this information.

columns.name: Station ID
columns.description: Station Area associated with the address where the incident happened (SFFD indicates overall results)

columns.name: Call Type
columns.description: Type of Call: Calls are divided into EMS and Fire/Rescue/Other

columns.name: Total Emergency Calls
columns.description: Number of calls that require an emergency response (Lights/Sirens)

columns.name: Total Non-emergency Calls
columns.description: Number of calls that did not require an emergency response (Lights/Sirens)

columns.name: Emergency Response
columns.description: Average time between dispatch and on scene for the first unit arriving on scene (Emergency Calls)

columns.name: Non-emergency Response
columns.description: Average time between dispatch and on scene for the first unit arriving on scene (Non Emergency Calls)

columns.name: Data As Of
columns.description: Last data included in the 30-day rolling time interval

columns.name: Data Loaded At
columns.description: Date & time (PST) when this dataset was last loaded into the Open Data Portal
